introduction: The Computer Networks Lab is designed to simplify complex networking concepts through interactive simulations. From CSMA/CD to DNS, this lab enables students to visualize, analyze, and optimize network protocols and data flow with hands-on precision. Students will explore protocol design, understand data flow, and analyze network performance.

experiments.name: Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection (CSMA/CD)
Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Avoidance (CSMA/CA)

objective:
• Understanding Network Protocols: Simulate CSMA/CD, Distance Vector Routing, TCP, and DNS to grasp core networking principles.
  • Analyzing Data Flow & Performance: Examine packet transmission, congestion control, and network behavior to optimize efficiency.
  • Bridging Theory & Practice: Apply hands-on simulations to design, test, and fine-tune network protocols for real-world applications.

courseAlignment.description: The syllabi of this lab aligns to the following universities in India.
universities: Computer Networks is a professional core course in Computer Science and Engineering (PCC-CS601) recommended in the AICTE model curriculum.
